error.message: Call to deprecated function drupal_basename(). Deprecated in drupal:8.0.0 and is removed from drupal:9.0.0. Use \Drupal\Core\File\FileSystem::basename().
Call to deprecated function drupal_unlink(). Deprecated in drupal:8.0.0 and is removed from drupal:9.0.0. Use \Drupal\Core\File\FileSystem::unlink().
Call to deprecated function drupal_mkdir(). Deprecated in drupal:8.0.0 and is removed from drupal:9.0.0. Use \Drupal\Core\File\FileSystem::mkdir().
Call to deprecated function drupal_mkdir(). Deprecated in drupal:8.0.0 and is removed from drupal:9.0.0. Use \Drupal\Core\File\FileSystem::mkdir().
Call to deprecated function drupal_rmdir(). Deprecated in drupal:8.0.0 and is removed from drupal:9.0.0. Use \Drupal\Core\File\FileSystem::rmdir().
Call to deprecated function drupal_rmdir(). Deprecated in drupal:8.0.0 and is removed from drupal:9.0.0. Use \Drupal\Core\File\FileSystem::rmdir().

Call to deprecated function drupal_get_profile(). Deprecated in drupal:8.3.0 and is removed from drupal:9.0.0. Use the install_profile container parameter or \Drupal::installProfile() instead. If you are accessing the value before it is written to configuration during the installer use the $install_state global. If you need to access the value before container is available you can use BootstrapConfigStorageFactory to load the value directly from configuration.
Add core_version_requirement: ^8 || ^9 to system_stream_wrapper.info.yml to designate that the module is compatible with Drupal 9. See https://www.drupal.org/node/3070687.
